title: Monogram decorative typeface found in Ballard Designs
content:
I am looking for any information on this typeface. Is this an available font or is it custom?

Any information would be appreciated.

Thanks

The upload function doesn’t seem to be working. Here is a link.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/16288713@N02/1753643459/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071110223409/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/16288713@N02/1753643459/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/16288713@N02/1753643459/")

 [‹ Eurythmic logotype stressed sans caps w/ tiny serifs](http://web.archive.org/web/20071110223409/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38548 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) wide slab on Pink Floyd "A Saucerful of Secrets" album cover - Volta {Loremipsum} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071110223409/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38544 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Kelli_99

comments.content:
I would also appreciate any information.  
Could you insert an image or provide a URL please?
This looks like a Didot that has been decorated. It is possible that it was a real 19th century metal type. I am not an official type ID guy. Maybe one will show up soon.

\> _I am not an official type ID guy._

Is anyone? :^D

I haven’t seen those before, but vintage type is not my speciality.
This looks like something you’d find in a Dover stock art collection. :-) Mikey

<cite> Is anyone? :^D </cite>

Well if not - then very very nearly.
